page.title: 02HEATH & REACH
page.content:
A Parish of some 2400 acres, it has been known since the first Domesday Book when its population was 111. In 1981 the population was 1278.
Surrounded on three sides by 5 active and disused sand quaries, the village contains a church, a chapel, 5 public houses and a school recently threatened with closure.
Heath Band, a well known brass band throughout Bedfordshire is based in the village.
{St. Leonards Church}dates from the 16th Century and the{Chapel}from 1900.
Heath & Reach also borders{Kings Wood {and Bakers Wood,}two of Bedfordshires most important woodlands.
